pageContext.claim: “Kanye West must have some power because you probably saw, I doubled my African-American poll numbers. We went from 11 to 22 in one week.”
pageContext.analysis: On April 29, a Reuters/Ipsos poll reported that Trump's approval with black men — not black Americans, as Trump claimed — was 22 percent. His approval with black men a week before was 11 percent with this poll, which uses a non-probability online sample, a methodology that a 2014 Pew Research study found doesn't necessarily accurately represent African Americans. A Pew Research Center poll released on May 3 reported that only 13 percent of African Americans approve of Trump. In January that number was 14 percent.
